cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 245 mi (395 km) south of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Creeping westward, then forecast to drift northwest and curl north toward the central Texas coast before bending northeast across Louisiana later in the 5-day period
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Port Aransas and High Island, near Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: south of Port Aransas, TX to the mouth of the Rio Grande, and east of Intracoastal City, LA to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Port Aransas, TX to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island and southwestern Louisiana coast (Cameron to Vermilion Bay) with lesser effects spreading east to Ocean Springs, MS
weather_observation.wind: Only a small (≤14%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy with occasional gusts below 39 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft possible in Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas and adjacent tidal waterways if long on-shore flow develops
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals near 10 inches possible Saturday–Wednesday; risk of flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches; minor river rises possible in southeast Louisiana
